ygData.subject: RE: programmable game pad
ygData.msgSnippet: Greetings Harmonie! Go to www.chproducts.com   and see what they have.  There is a gizmo there called ProThrottle and that is what I
ygData.messageBody:
Greetings Harmonie!

Go to www.chproducts.com <http://www.chproducts.com> and see what they
have. There is a gizmo there called ProThrottle and that is what I use (cus
it's stuff that I had for playing airplane simulator games.) Also, it's
worth a call to them - they are real nice people and can maybe better
explain to you how it works and be able to tell you whether or not it can be
hooked up to a laptop computer.

They also have a USB Gamepad that might help you out.

G'Luck!

Sylly Songsynger
<Spirit of the Moon>
Bard of the 39th song
somewhere on Innoruuk

p.s. its good to hear another harmonie around here cuz sometimes the one we
got gets pretty uhmm shall we say uhmm distorted??? <g> (just kiddin' Harm!)

-----Original Message-----
From: harmoniemoonsong@...
[mailto:harmoniemoonsong@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 22, 1999 1:37 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] programmable game pad

From: harmoniemoonsong@...

A few days / weeks ago there was a brief discussion on using
a programmable game pad to assist in twisting songs... (significantly reduce
"button mashing")

Since i almost always play on my laptop, anything that
improves the keyboard layout is of interest to me. Could someone send me or
post additional information. I bought the Sidewinder Game pad pro yesterday
and can not seem to get eq to recognize it. (not even for mouse movement).
Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.

Harmonie Moonsong
Lvl 20 Bard
Lost Souls of Norrath
Bristlebane

and assorted other characters... lol
